name: For The Computers
description:
The game is about choosing propaganda for the computers who have control over the Earth to influence the human race indirectly.  You are given two choices and each will impact a statistic to get closer to 0 or 100, and if a statistic rises above 100 or below 0 then the computers euthanize you for failing your objective. This game was inspired by the game Reigns where you have to choose to respond with one of two responses to situations in your kingdom and the goal is to keep your power as long as possible.

Here is the full story of this game: The year is  2163 and you have been captured while trying to destroy a computer server, the computers force you to work as a slave that interprets human emotion for them by deciding between two propaganda messages that have been generated by other slaves. You use the statistics meter to see which statistics need to be raised or lowered and get alerts from the computers about specific situations happening that may impact the statistics. You work on one task every year in the story and the computers make your body semi-immortal so that you can work for them until they have no use for you. If you cause the statistics to be in humanities favor causing humanity to win then you lose as the computers kill you for betraying them, and if the statistics lead to the human race going extinct then the computers will kill you for failing your objective. And after ~23 years you get a chance to get revenge... I don't wanna spoil the end...
